history.content: Enrollment in CS upper division courses is front-loaded. We over enroll during the first three weeks of the semester expecting continued attrition to right-size the class so that teaching staff can adequately support the students enrolled.  In the end, the same number of students is accommodated but we are able to give students who would otherwise be enrolled later entrance into our courses earlier and thereby reduce stress and uncertainty (at least, that is our intent). The flip side of this is that it is no longer possible to add upper division cs courses at this time for F15.

children.subject: It's not actually a policy change but a practice that has persisted for ~ 20+ years.  You are absolutely correct though that it could be more prominently shared.  I'll put it on my list to include this information here for future semesters: http://www.eecs.berkeley.edu/Policies/enrollment.shtml

Okay, but I think the department should be better to notify students about such a policy change beforehand. I already caught up with three weeks of lecture and did the homework over the weekend, and found that I cannot enroll in that course.

history.content: When I try to add CS 168, Telebears says "The class you have requested to add is currently not open for enrollment." What does that mean? I think there are still available seats for that course according to schedule.berkeley.edu.
history.subject: CS 168 Enrollment
